definition: to pretend to look happy/to force oneself to smile

sentences.english: The sound of happy laughters called up memories of his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 這些歡笑聲使他回憶起童年時代。

sentences.english: Shared laughter creates a bond of friendships.
sentences.chinese: 分享歡笑創造友誼的結合力。

sentences.english: Even if accompanied with dreary day let us smile with teats .
sentences.chinese: 即使陰雨作伴讓我們流淚著歡笑。

sentences.english: He makes grandiose claims with a mixture of mirth and sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 他會帶着歡笑和真摯要求鉅額索賠。

sentences.english: Pleasure is frail like a dewdrop， while it laughs it dies.
sentences.chinese: 喜樂像露珠一樣地脆弱，它在歡笑中死去。

sentences.english: And eh grasshopper laughs in the merry scene.
sentences.chinese: 歡笑的蟈蟈兒不會在熱鬧裏打瞌睡。

sentences.english: Your laughter flying in the arena, winning glory for the number of classes you best.
sentences.chinese: 你的歡笑飛揚在賽場，爲班爭光數你最棒。

sentences.english: As the mood of the festival set in, laughter and role playing antics filled the campus.
sentences.chinese: 孩子與家長們的歡笑聲填滿了校園。

sentences.english: It's a time of big smiles, full tummies and a whole lotta love.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個充滿了歡笑，飽飽的肚子和愛的時刻。

sentences.english: You're lucky, rejoicing in my delicate hands.
sentences.chinese: 你，多好，爲我的纖纖素手而歡笑。

sentences.english: I smile, when you face the habit.
sentences.chinese: 強顏歡笑，是莪面對妳時旳習慣。

sentences.english: Let that new song be the sound of children laughing.
sentences.chinese: 那新歌是孩子們的歡笑聲。

sentences.english: The world smiles with Hengyun Automobile Service Co Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 恆運旅汽給全世界帶來歡笑。

sentences.english: Take time to laugh, It is the music of the soul.
sentences.chinese: 花些時間歡笑，它是心靈的音樂。
我要逆來順受，忍氣吞聲強作歡笑。

sentences.english: The hall resounded with the laughter of children.
sentences.chinese: 大廳裏充滿了孩子們的歡笑聲。

definition: to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
a drip/a little bit/intravenous drip (used to administer drugs)
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
